cfswitch.cfcase: Click the button on the right to update
Click arrow on left to return without submitting changes
Specifies the server for sending SMTP mail messages. You can specify an Internet address (for example, mail.company.com) or the IP address of the mail server (for example, 127.0.0.1).
If your mail server requires authentication, you can specify a user name and password to use.
Select this check box to have ColdFusion Sign the Mail.
"Location of the Keystore" - Keystore containing the private key and certificate. The supported type is JKS (java key store) and pkcs12.
Alias of the key with which the certificate and private key is stored in Keystore. If it is not specified then the first entry in the Keystore will be picked up.
Password with which the private key is stored. If it is not specified, KeystorePassword will be used as KeyPassword as well.
Select this check box to have ColdFusion verify that it can connect to this mail server when you submit this form.
The default port number for mail servers. The standard SMTP mail server port is 25.

cfcase.br: Specifies backup servers for sending SMTP mail messages. Use a comma to separate the names of multiple servers. To specify a port number other than the default, use a colon (for example, mail.company.com:123). If your mail server requires authentication different from the default server, you can specify a user name and password in the format user:password@mail.company.com.

cfswitch.cfcase: Select this check box to keep the connection to a mail server open for reuse after delivering a message (recommended).
Specifies the time that ColdFusion should wait for a response from the mail server.
Enable SSL socket connections to mail server
Select this check box to enable SSL encryption on the connections to the mail server.
Enable TLS connection to mail server
Select this check box to enable Transport Level Security (TLS) on the connection to the mail server.
Specifies the time the mail spooler waits to process spooled mail.
Specifies the maximum number of simultaneous threads that ColdFusion uses to deliver spooled mail. A higher number indicates an increase in the volume of mail messages that are delivered.
Select this check box to spool messages for delivery by the mail spooler (recommended). When not selected, the mail spooler attempts to deliver messages during page processing.

Spooling to disk is more robust, because the messages are written to disk and are delivered even if you restart ColdFusion. Spooling to memory substantially increases performance, but it requires additional memory and places the messages in volatile storage.
Maximum number of messages spooled to memory
Specifies the maximum number of messages that ColdFusion holds in memory before switching to spooling messages to disk.
Select the type of SMTP-related error messages to log.
Log all mail messages sent by ColdFusion
Select this check box to save the To, From, and Subject fields of messages to a log file.
Server port must be numeric and greater than zero.
Timeout value must be numeric and greater than zero.
Spool interval must be numeric and greater than zero.
Maximum number of simultaneous threads must be numeric and greater than zero.
Maximum number of messages spooled to memomy must be numeric and greater than zero.
The mail server connection was not tested.
